data.title: Microids signs agreement to produce two new games based on Taito franchises
data.text:
Microid signs agreement with Taito to produce two new games

Microids has signed an agreement with Taito to produce two titles based on the Japanese developerâ€™s famous franchises, the company announced.

Microids has signed an agreement with Taito to produce two titles based on the Japanese developer's famous franchises, the company announced.

The two games, which are already in development, are developed by "experienced studios" and expected to launch in 2022.

"Microids international development strategy is going strong and we are proud to collaborate with Taito," said Microids CEO Stephane Longeard in a press release. "We are delighted the Japanese giant fully entrusted us with the development of these titles. We cannot wait to unveil the two projects we're working on and we strongly believe they will surprise a lot of people!"

Taito president and represented director Katsuhiko Iwaki added, "We have full confidence in Microids' capability to revive two of our licenses through the titles they will offer in the coming months. Gamers will be amazed to experience these games come back on today's consoles..

This This This. I forgot it was Taito that made this. Sonic Blast Man 3 with 4 player coop or even a remake of 1 with coop. These games were charming as hell and I played the fuck out of it on the SNES when I was a kid.

I'd be happy with anything that isn't Bubble Bobble or Space Invaders (not that those aren't great, but they're quite well covered for new releases at this point). Darius is fine right now too.

Elevator Action is definitely at the top of my own list. Can't decide if I'd like it to be a heavy expansion of the original idea (a la DK94) or just an update or new version of the original (though ultimately we already got that on the PS3).

Does Taito still "handle" Lufia, or did Square take over on that one? They handled the DS version after all.
